Detailed Description

Describes a connection between two nodes.

The ID of one of the nodes are stored here (the node where this connection starts) and the other is where this connection is stored (where the connection ends).

Definition at line 37 of file OldConnection.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

OldConnection::OldConnection (   )  [inline]
 

Creates an empty connection.

This is implemented in the fastest possible way, no initialization is done. Does work together with the createFromDataBuffer method.

float64 OldConnection::getPenaltyFactor (  byte  roadClass,
bool  isRamp = false,
byte  speedLimit = 50
) 
 

Calculates the penalty factor, which is used by the getConnectionTime() and getConnectionCost() methods.

The penalty factor is based on the roadclass and if the connection represents a U-turn, and whether it is a ramp or not.

Parameters:
roadClass The roadclass of the ssi the connection traverses.
speedLimit The speedlimit of the ssi the connection traverses.
isRamp True if it is a ramp.
Returns:
The penalty factor.

uint32  toNodeID
)  const
 

Get the signpost going to toNodeID.

Parameters:
theMap The map this connection is stored in.
toNode The node the connection goes to.
Returns:
The signposts going from this connection to toNode. An empty vector is returned if no signposts.

Definition at line 619 of file OldConnection.h.

bool OldConnection::isMultiConnection (   )  const [inline]
 

Is this connection a multi connection?.

Multi connections stretch over several items and are used to repesent special traffic rules for turns that covers several normal connections. Ex. U-turns, multidig situoations.

Returns:
True if this connection covers several normal connections. False if this is a normal connection.

bool OldConnection::updateConnAttributesFromConn (  OldConnection *  otherConn  ) 
 

Method that updates all attributes of a connection to the values of another connection.

This includes e.g. vehicle restrictions, crossing kind

No sing post data is updated.

For more documentation see the updateAttributesFromItem method in OldItem.h.

Parameters:
otherConn The connection from which to get update values.
Returns:
True if some attribute was updated for the connection, false if not.

Definition at line 497 of file OldConnection.h.

byte OldConnection::m_exitCount [protected]
 

The number of the exit where to turn at the crossing.

E.g: 

             ___________   
            ***** |        If this crossing describes the *-marked 
                 *|        turn then:
                 *|        m_exitCount = 0 (first way to the right)
                 *|        m_crossingKind = CROSSING_3WAYS_T
                 *|        m_turnDirection = RIGHT
                  |        
        *

Definition at line 512 of file OldConnection.h.

bool OldConnection::m_restrictionsExplicitlySet [protected]
 

Attribute indicating that the restrictions for this OldConnection has been explicitly set and may not be overwritten by another restriction.

Used during map generation. No need to save it in the map file.
